NetCoupler 0.0.4.9000

Classify direct, ambiguous, or no effect between exposure and network nodes.

Source: R/summarize-estimates.R
nc_classify_effects.Rd

Using the output of the nc_exposure_estimates() or nc_outcome_estimates(), classify whether the exposure variable has a direct, ambiguous, or no link with the index node metabolic variable, conditional on neighbouring metablic variables and on potential confounders.

nc_classify_effects(.tbl)

nc_filter_estimates(.tbl)

Arguments

.tbl

Multi-model estimates generated from nc_exposure_estimates() or nc_outcome_estimates() that contain the model summaries.

Value

Outputs a tibble with model estimates between the exposure and the individual index network nodes, along with the classification of direct effect or not.

Functions

  • nc_filter_estimates: Filter out estimates so only exposure estimates are kept. Adds a column with the neighbouring metabolite variables listed.

See also

See the vignette("description") for a detailed description of the algorithm used to classify direct effects.

Examples


library(dplyr)
metabolite_network <- simulated_data %>%
  select(matches("metabolite")) %>%
  nc_create_network()
multimodel_exposure <- simulated_data %>%
  mutate(Random = rnorm(nrow(.))) %>%
  nc_exposure_estimates(
    .graph = metabolite_network,
    .exposure = "exposure",
    .adjustment_vars = c("age", "Random"),
    .model_function = lm
   )

nc_filter_estimates(multimodel_exposure)
#> # A tibble: 114 x 10
#>    exposure index_node estimate std_error statistic   p_value conf_low conf_high
#>    <chr>    <chr>         <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#>  1 exposure metabolit…   -0.725    0.0157     -46.3 1.61e-318   -0.756    -0.694
#>  2 exposure metabolit…   -0.711    0.0253     -28.1 7.89e-147   -0.760    -0.661
#>  3 exposure metabolit…   -0.767    0.0140     -54.8 0.          -0.794    -0.739
#>  4 exposure metabolit…   -0.756    0.0242     -31.2 9.63e-175   -0.803    -0.708
#>  5 exposure metabolit…   -0.725    0.0258     -28.1 1.23e-146   -0.776    -0.674
#>  6 exposure metabolit…   -0.764    0.0155     -49.2 0.          -0.794    -0.734
#>  7 exposure metabolit…   -0.764    0.0247     -31.0 2.40e-172   -0.813    -0.716
#>  8 exposure metabolit…   -0.799    0.0139     -57.6 0.          -0.826    -0.771
#>  9 exposure metabolit…    0.284    0.0256      11.1 1.02e- 27    0.234     0.334
#> 10 exposure metabolit…    0.227    0.0156      14.6 1.04e- 45    0.197     0.258
#> # … with 104 more rows, and 2 more variables: adjusted_vars <chr>,
#> #   neighbour_vars <chr>
nc_classify_effects(multimodel_exposure)
#> # A tibble: 12 x 9
#> # Groups:   exposure, index_node [12]
#>    exposure index_node estimate std_error p_value conf_low conf_high adj_p_value

#>  1 exposure metabolit… -0.799      0.0139 0        -0.826    -0.771      0

#> 12 exposure metabolit…  0.375      0.0207 0         0.335     0.416      0

library(survival)
multimodel_outcome <- simulated_data %>%
  mutate(Random = rnorm(nrow(.))) %>%
  nc_outcome_estimates(
    .graph = metabolite_network,
    .outcome = "survival::Surv(survival_time, case_status)",
    .adjustment_vars = c("age", "Random"),
    .model_function = survival::coxph,
    .exponentiate = TRUE
   )

nc_filter_estimates(multimodel_outcome)
#> # A tibble: 114 x 10
#>    outcome index_node estimate std_error statistic  p_value conf_low conf_high
